intro: Ophiorrhiza hunanica, commonly known as the Hunan marsh bean, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is a small shrub characterized by its opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain numerous tiny seeds. Ophiorrhiza hunanica is typically found in moist, swampy areas and is native to parts of China.
